node.title: 'A little extra pressure': Bellerive readies for 'holy grail' Ashes Test
node.alt: A man in a raincoat stands in the middle of a cricket ground next to machinery
node.description: Bellerive Oval ground curator Marcus Pamplin admits to feeling "a little bit of extra pressure" as Hobart gets ready to host the fifth Ashes Test, which will bring an international focus and an estimated $27 million in revenue to the state.
node.content:
["Marcus Pamplin has prepared grounds for international cricket teams before, but will face his biggest challenge next month when his work at Hobart's Bellerive Oval is front and centre for the newly-relocated fifth Ashes Test.", "\"We put our heart and soul into every cricket wicket, even if it's just a practice game,\" he said.", "\"We just want to do the best we can and get the same result for every\u00a0match and try [to]\u00a0replicate it for every game.", "\"But a test match is just that little bit extra as far as the pressure of it all, and the meaning of it all.", "Cricket Australia has confirmed Bellerive will host the fifth Ashes Test in\u00a0mid-January after it was moved from Perth due to Western Australia's COVID-19 restrictions.", "The fifth Ashes\u00a0Test\u00a0was put out to\u00a0tender last week, with the Cricket Australia board unanimously voting to award the final leg of the Ashes to Hobart, making it the first test match to be held at Bellerive since 2016 and the first Ashes Test ever to be held in Tasmania.", "", "
Tasmanian Premier Peter\u00a0Gutwein says as well as being an economic boost, the fifth Ashes Test\u00a0will inspire the next generation of cricket fans.(ABC News: Liz Gwynn)
", "After spending the\u00a0week lobbying Cricket Australia, Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein\u00a0said he \"couldn't be happier\" at the board's decision.", "\"This wasn't all about money, this was about making history,\" he said.", "\"This was about delivering, for cricket lovers all around the country, here in Tasmania, and importantly all around the world.", "The Tasmanian Government will contribute $4 million of taxpayer money, but Mr Gutwein said the Test would provide substantial economic returns for the state.", "\"We'll get a $27 million return, that's what's estimated \u2026\u00a0[and] there'll be some smaller and other ancillary costs associated with the broadcast,\" he said.", "\"[It's]\u00a0a $4 million match fee to ensure that Tasmania, over five days, can not only have the nation's eyes on us, but the world's eyes on just how good a stadium this is\u00a0but, importantly, just how good this state is overall.", "
'Bowled by a Tassie flipper'
", "Critics of Bellerive's capability to host the Test match have cited its smaller capacity\u00a0as a major drawback.", "Earlier this week Tasmanian Public Health authorities approved an increase of the stadium's seating\u00a0capacity, increasing it from a 10,000-seat limit to 14,000-seat capacity.", "Part of that reasoning was the state's high vaccination rate, which has since reached its\u00a090 per cent double-dose milestone for those aged 16 years and over.", "", "
Legendary bowler Shane Warne is questioning\u00a0whether Bellerive can\u00a0attract the necessary crowds.(AAP: Michael Dodge)
", "When rumours circulated that Hobart had been awarded the fifth Test, former Australian\u00a0player Shane Warne\u00a0questioned\u00a0the decision.", "\"I just wouldn't have done it that way. I just think \u2014 if it's 2-all, or 2-1, 1-nil, whatever it might be \u2014\u00a0we want to be fair to the fans all over Australia, for the international fans and I don't think you can fit them all in at Hobart,\" he said\u00a0while commentating the first Ashes test in Brisbane.", "\"One of the reasons that Hobart lost their Test match is because no one was turning up, that's one of the reasons they lost it and there was talk of Canberra for the fifth test or somewhere else, so let's hope the people turn out \u2026\u00a0and Hobart can squeeze in 15,000 (sic) people.\"", "But Mr Gutwein said he was confident that Bellerive would be at capacity for each day of the final Ashes Test.", "\"I am absolutely confident that Tasmanians will turn up in droves, but also that we're going to see significant interstate visitors as well as international visitors for this,\" Mr Gutwein said.", "\"At the end of the day, we've got the Test, we're going to make it work, and we're going to put on a fantastic spectacle.", "\"To cricket lovers around the country, come to Tasmania.\u00a0You'll get a fantastic Test, but you'll also have the benefit of being able to share in the best food, the best wine and the best beer in the world.", "\"The sun always shines in January in Tasmania.\"", "", "
The second Test between Australia and South Africa in 2016 was the last Test played at Bellerive.(ABC News: Jon Healy)
", "Meteorologist Simon McCulloch said that, while it was too early to predict a Test-week forecast, weather conditions should be optimal for a potential decider in the Ashes series.", "\"We do get a bit of a bad rap in Hobart for getting a lot of rain but, generally speaking, we don't get large amounts of rain \u2026\u00a0so it might have a fairly minimal effect on the game itself,\" he said.", "\"The one slight dampener is [that] it is a La Nina year, so we might have a slight increase in rainfall but no more so than the eastern parts of the country.\"", "
Ponting hoping for a fifth Test decider
", "Former Australia\u00a0Test cricket captain, Tasmanian-born Ricky Ponting, was confident his home state could handle an Ashes game.", "\"How good for the whole state of Tasmania to have such a high-profile sporting event, a sporting contest like the Ashes come to Hobart,\" Ponting\u00a0told Channel 7.\u00a0", "\"I know they'll put on a great show down there, day-night game, let's just hope that every single day's sold out\u00a0and, even better, let's hope the series is on the line come the fifth Test.\"", "Bowling legend-turned-commentator Brett Lee was also supportive.\u00a0", "\"I'm not sure if it's ever snowed in a day-night Test ever, but there's a good chance in Hobart, it will be cold, but it's a great place to play cricket,\" Lee said.", "\"The crowd enjoy their cricket. Is there enough crowd to go watch the game? Who knows, but they certainly love their cricket and it's a great wicket down there for Test cricket.\"", "", "
The Test will be a day-night game with a capacity for 14,000 seated spectators.(ABC News)
"]
